abstract.shortdesc: Step results let users know that they are on the right track.

rule.rule-statement: For simple tasks, where little to nothing happens between each step, omit <stepresult> as much as possible, and use <result> at the end of the tasks to let users know that they have completed the operation successfully.

examplefig.codeblock: <task> <title>Turn off the alarm</title> <steps> <step> <cmd>Click the <uicontrol>Turn off</uicontrol> button.</cmd> </step> <step> <cmd>Enter your code on the dial pad</cmd> </step> </steps> <result>The alarm is off. The system emits a long beep.</result> </task>

rule.rule-statement: In complex system tasks, when something happens on the screen or when data is added, modified or deleted from a system, use <stepresult>.
